column.name: description
column.value: A hero classified as a mage has received the blessing of Dura's sorcery. They are able to utilize spells in various ways to damage and overall hinder their opponents.

column.name: description
column.value: A hero classified as a tank has received the blessing of Dura's fortitude. They are better equipped to withstand damage sustained from their opponents, as they are bulkier and defensive. Tank heroes excel on the frontlines where they can protect their teammates by absorbing damage.

column.name: description
column.value: A hero classified as a warrior has received the blessing of Dura's might. Packing more of a punch, they are able to deal higher physical damage to their opponents while having some sustainability.

column.name: description
column.value: A hero classified as a ranger has received the blessing of Dura's celerity. As the name suggests, these heroes attack their opponents from a distance and are usually nimble, making them the perfect assassins. They're moreso specialist damage dealers.

column.name: description
column.value: A hero classified as support has received the blessing of Dura's sustenance. They are able to nurture their teammates, providing them with health boosts and other stat buffs. Support heroes excel in the backlines where they are better protected, allowing them to continue doling out buffs to their teammates.

column.name: description
column.value: Strength-based heroes are adept at dealing physical damage to their adversaries. These types of heroes are usually of the warrior or tank class, but this is not always the case.

column.name: description
column.value: Intelligence-based heroes use spells to deal magic damage to their opponents. Although these types of heroes are usually supports or mages, they may sometimes fall under a different class.

column.name: description
column.value: Agility-based heroes deal physical damage like strength-based heroes do, however they don't deal as much and instead rely on speed and dodging in a fight. These types of heroes are usually classified as assassins or supports, but not always.

column.name: description
column.value: Tanks are sturdy heroes, that can soak loads of incoming damage. They often have means to heal themselves.

column.name: description
column.value: AoE stands for Area of Effect, heroes with that role posses many skills with area damage. They are great for attacking many foes at once.

column.name: description
column.value: Heroes with the Continuous Damage role specialize in dealing steady damage during the duration of the fight.

column.name: description
column.value: Debuffers are heroes that use their skills to incapacitate enemy heroes in ways such as making them attack slower, poisoning them, or other methods of weakening.

column.name: description
column.value: Control-type heroes use their abilities to disable or charm some of their foes. They remove enemies from the battlefield or make them fight their allies.

column.name: description
column.value: Buffers use their skills to help their allies on the battlefield. They can increase their allies' haste, defense, or other attributes.

column.name: description
column.value: Heroes with the Burst Damage role deal damage similarly to other damage dealing roles. The main difference between them is that Burst Damage heroes deal most of their damage in the form of short bursts unlike steady damage dealt by Continuous Damage or AoE heroes.

column.name: description
column.value: Regen-type heroes are healers using their powers to regenerate their allies' health.

column.name: description
column.value: Assassin are heroes specialized in quickly taking down single heroes.
